sub_title: Senior Scientist, Formulation, Drug Product Development, CMC
summary:
Experienced professional in pharmaceutical development, particularly in drug product development of vaccines, biologics and other parenteral formulations

PhD with background in pharmacy, 6+ years in industry (small company and large pharma) and before that 10 years in academia

Primary focus on biologics/vaccines, such as viruses, proteins, monoclonal antibodies, peptides but also experience with small molecules. Expertise in wide range of formulations and delivery systems (e.g. sustained release) and administration routes (e.g. dermal route), and from initial formulation screening until late stage development, including relevant analytics

Project lead and member of several cross-functional teams focusing either CMC projects or continuous improvement activities, including stakeholder management

Leading people, mentoring junior colleagues and PhD students, supervision of undergraduate students

Approximately 20 scientific publications and several presentations at international events (https://scholar.google.nl/citations?user=gdiy5qsAAAAJ&hl=en)

authors.headline: Senior Scientist, Formulation, Drug Product Development, CMC

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Early phase formulation/drug product development, life cycle management and concept development of new technology (e.g. novel administration routes or devices, adjuvants, analytics) of vaccine drug products against bacterial and viral diseases.

Activities include:
- Responsible for formulation/drug product transitions from discovery to early development and eventually to the late development 
- Project lead to initiate CMC life cycle management of high priority program
- Project lead to set up adjuvant preparation and characterization capabilities to support preclinical development
- Presenting in internal cross-functional review meetings 
- Planning, reporting and reviewing studies 
- Contribution to MAA/BLA/IND submission as author and reviewer (module 3)
- Collaboration with internal and external (e.g. CROs, suppliers) stakeholders
- Scientific support to junior colleagues.
- Co-lead for project accelerating of drug product development for First-in-Human clinical studies
- Coordination of external conference presentations of Drug Product Development
- Completed JnJ Project Leader and People Leader trainings
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist, Formulation Science and Technology - Drug Product Development

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Late stage drug product development of protein, adeno- and MVA-virus based vaccines for diseases such as HIV, RSV (respiratory syncytial virus) and Ebola.

Tasks include:
- Accountable for timely execution of formulation development activities for late-stage development programs in alignment with fill/finish activities and CMC milestones 
- Accountable for several studies and activities such as formulation robustness, development stability, in-use stability, implementation of new primary packaging, assessment of alternative storage conditions
- Contribution to continuous process validation such as criticality analysis and control strategy
- Contribution to MAA/BLA/IND submission as author and reviewer (module 3)
- Support of Drug Product Process Performance Qualification manufacturing
- Communication with CMC stakeholders in and outside Janssen organization (incl. CRO/CMOs)
- Scientific evaluation of temperature excursions of investigational products in clinical trials
- Participation to cross-functional project teams
- People management and recruitment of technicians
- Planning, reporting, presenting and reviewing studies
- Improvement of current technical and scientific know how of the group
profile_positions.title: Scientist, Formulation Development - Drug Product Development

profile_positions.description:
Technical and scientific feasibility evaluation of APIs for long acting injectable BEPO system based on biodegradable polymers. 

- Proof-of-feasibility /preformulation studies 
- Formulation development, in vitro dissolution studies, UPLC method development, viscosity, injection force, pharmacokinetics, chemical compatibility, API sourcing
- Project management, communication with external and internal (e.g. business development) partners
- Analysis of candidate APIs based on regulatory, academic and other publicly available information
profile_positions.title: Formulation Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Development of dissolving and hollow microneedles for dermal nanoparticle-vaccine and protein delivery at Drug Delivery Technology group of LACDR. Project was part of IMI-funded European-wide COMPACT consortium focusing on improved delivery of biopharmaceuticals in collaboration between pharmaceutical industry and academia.

- Formulation development of hollow and dissolving microneedles and nanoparticles/liposomes.
- In vitro chacterization and analytics such as particle sizing (e.g. DLS, NTA, MFI), microscopy (SEM, light, confocal, fluorescence), AF4, BCA, fluorescent-labelling of proteins and polymers
- Ex vivo characterization of microneedles with human skin
- In vivo studies: designing of study protocols for vaccination studies, hands-on work (incl. ELISA and intracellular cytokine staining), member of university-level animal welfare body (article 9 / FELASA C-level)

- Supervision of PhD (2x), master (3x) and bachelor (4x) students,  teaching of undergraduate students, 
- Scientific reporting and presentations of the project and workpackage results within European consortium consisting of industrial and academic partners
- Project leader for two formulations within a consortium, all milestones reached within timelines
- 6 high-level (e.g. 3x in J Control Rel) papers published and several oral presentations at the international events
profile_positions.title: Post-doc Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Porous silicon for oral delivery of poorly soluble drugs 
- Pilot testing of inkjet printed of peptide drug formulations
- Writing of grant applications for international post-doc period (30 000 € personal grant received)
- Writing of review for Pharmacological Reviews journal on peptide delivery systems

- Teaching in lab practices in the courses of pharmaceutical compounding, pharmaceutical microbiology, biopharmacy, and supervising student groups in the drug therapy course. In addition, supervisor of two bachelor thesis.

Webmaster for units of Pharmaceutical technology and Biopharmacy.
profile_positions.title: University teacher /Post-doc

profile_positions.description:
- PhD Student at the School of Pharmacy, Pharmaceutical Techology
- PhD thesis titled "Novel materials for controlled peptide delivery: mesoporous silicon and photocrosslinked poly(ester anhydride)s" (PDF version: http://urn.fi/URN:ISBN:978-952-61-0789-9)

- Project based on multidisciplinary collaboration physicists, chemical engineers, aerosol scientist, pharmacists and physiologists funded by Academy of Finland
- Formulation and in vitro release testing of porous silicon micro- and nanoparticles developed for subcutaneous anti-obesity peptide delivery
- Formulation of polymer implants based on novel biodegradable polymers  in collaboration with chemical engineers from Aalto University. Besides in vitro release and mass loss studies, novel micro-CT analysis developed to examine evolution of the implant inner structure during drug release.
- HPLC method development and instrument maintenance
- Assistance in in vivo studies
- Five original research papers for PhD thesis and three papers outside of PhD thesis

- Teaching of lab practices in the course of medicine compouding, supervision of seven master thesis' and two bachelor thesis'.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: Finnish text book ”Biopharmacy and pharmacokinetics” (Biofarmasia ja farmakokinetiikka, Marvola, Urtti, Mönkkönen) 2nd ed. editing of graphs and illustrations, 2007
profile_positions.title: Figure and graphics editor of the university text book

volunteer_experiences.role: Treasurer, Vice President, Executive Committee member
volunteer_experiences.description:
- Treasurer and Member of Executive Committee 2005-08, Vice President 2006-07, election to Honorary Life Member 2008 
- Daily working on global  level in Executive Committee of IPSF (300 000 members in 70 countries)
- Working in international student teams consisting of members from each continent and different cultures
- Financial management of the Federation (annual budget of 50 000 euros)
- Coordination of the charity fund "Development Fund"
- Active input on all activities of the Federation  in the fields of public health, pharmacy education, professional development, program and logistical planning of annual events, relations with other international organizations

Boar Member/webmaster 2012
Boar Member/webmaster 2011
Chair 2010
Vice Chair 2009
Board Member 2008

The Society annually organises a scientific symposium discussing physical pharmacy and related topics and the board acts as a organising committee of this symposium.
http://www.fysikaalinenfarmasia.fi
Learning to Teach –working group member 2008-10, development of teaching and supervising skills of young pharmacists

Board member of Finnish Pharmacy Students' Association

Annual week-long meeting of Nordic pharmacy students with excursions and social events.
